Key Match Events: Jos Buttler’s 73 off 47 balls helped England overcome New Zealand
Glenn Phillips looked to have turned the tide with 62 off 36 balls
England’s bowlers were disciplined at the death to close out a 20-run victory
Pre-Game Insights: Anything other than a win would have all-but led to England being eliminated at the Super 12s stage
A semi-final place is far from assured as England still need to beat Sri Lanka on Saturday and hope Australia do not overhaul their net run-rate
Buttler clicking into gear, overcoming a pedestrian start and being dropped on eight and 40 to top-score
Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes celebrated the wicket of New Zealand’s Kane Williamson
A much-improved display from England after faltering against Ireland
Miscellaneous Highlights: Buttler was given a second let-off after Daryl Mitchell shelled a boundary chance
Phillips lost Williamson for a run-a-ball 40
Chris Jordan, whose eight-ball over at Abu Dhabi last year put New Zealand into the ascendancy, took boundary catches to see off Mitchell and Phillips in the 17th and 18th overs
